Reviews.Title: “basic hotel stuck in the 70's”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Battersea
Reviews.Content: If you are coming to Rome and think this is the shangi la of asian fame...think again! it is not!! it is a basic hotel near a motorway, with a decent pizzeria/restaurant next door...but overall, the hotel is stuck in a 70's time warp. Service at the front desk is slow and inefficient...there seem to be employees everywhere but none helping guests... they are either on the phone, staring at paper, writing in ledgers or having conversations about lord knows what which demands concentration and exuberance - usually while guests are standing in the queue to check out/check in/ask a question/order a taxi...you name it... the rooms are basic. NO wifi, basic towels, fierce lighting, dorm style beds, basic toiletries and tiled floors (so, beware if you are on floor 1 and have someone above you!) if you face the 'park' you will hear traffic from 7 am until midnight.. the breakfast room looks like a wedding hall banquet with a decent breakfast (cold/hot buffet) but all too stiff and formal...this is not a good tourist hotel, it is for businessmen like me on a budget and an overnight stay. It is not very comfortable, nor is it convenient to much apart from EUR location. The staff have seen better days, perhaps when the hotel opened in the 70's...

Reviews.Title: “An "oldie," but a goodie!”
Reviews.Author: Mis_Adventurous
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an aged and tired decor, but the location for those needing the GRA or the Colombo is fantastic. The location is also within walking distance of the EUROMA 2 (the largest mall in Lazio). Our room was a typical European room (FIRM mattress, flat pillows, and sparse surroundings). All of this would be fine except that the walls are PAPER THIN. I could actually hear the guy in the next room switching on and off the lights on the bedside table! Apparently, this guy also had malaria or something since he COUGHED all night . . . and we could hear him! So, for that I give this hotel an AVERAGE rating. I would rate it higher than the Sheraton Roma (we have stayed here many times) . . . at least the staff at the Shangri la are capable of checking travelers into their rooms in less than an hour. Finally, our keys kept losing their ability to open the door . . . I did find it funny that the guy at the front desk wanted to see my passport (which was in the room) before resetting my key! The staff in the breakfast room were VERY accommodating! Our room was not ready when we arrived, but the cappuccino and cornetto with a selection of fresh fruit took away some of the aggravation of waiting. By the way, the water pressure at this hotel is AWESOME! Take a nice hot shower with plenty of water pressure was a huge plus!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and set-up”
Reviews.Author: usintheusa
Reviews.Content: We checked in with a pet, this was no problem for them and they did not charge us more for this. We also had a no smoking room which really was a non smoking room - sometimes we have encountered rooms sold as non-smoking, but reeking of smoke nevertheless. We stayed for 4 nights and enjoyed every minute of it. The restaurant offered sumptuous meals and was able to accommodate special dietary needs. The New Year's party was excellent too - good food, good music and great service. The room had all the important features and we loved the shower, which was surprisingly roomy compared to other hotel showers we have previously encountered in Italy. This is a stone's throw from lake EUR and also EUROMA2, a major shopping mall with great store and restaurant options.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned, noisy,...”
Reviews.Author: Sreinyer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old and noisy, poor location. The room I got smelled bad (despite I asked a smoke free they gave a room that smelled like tobacco). When you open the windows there's a lot of noise.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good. Let down a little by location.”
Reviews.Author: Zarek
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a one night business trip. Quite stylish athough in a rather dated way. The tired decor was compensated for by some high quality specification - floor tiles, bathroom suite, wooden ceilings etc. The room was a little disappointing, cramped as is typical of Rome, with a poor desk. The restaurant is very stylish, with a great terrace and excellent food. The location of the hotel is not so pretty, dominated by a busy road and the trip to the centre is a fair walk. Value for money wise, at £140/night, a little expensive and while fine for a business trip not quite passig my would pay with my own money test.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, peaceful atmosphere, clear rooms.”
Reviews.Author: eviar4
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent. The staff was very polite, trying to satisfy every need of the clients. We are sure that such staff has not to be afraid of unemployment and crisis. The breakfast was rich. Most interestingly the hotel was very clear and peaceful. Unfortunately we could stay there for two nights only. We shall definitely prefere to stay there, next time that we shall visit ROME, despite the unfavorable location. (The EUR area is outside the Historical center).

Reviews.Title: “Sea-resort-style hotel in the metropoly...”
Reviews.Author: Dorotka_BS
Reviews.Content: First of all, don't believe the pictures on the hotel's website. They bring images of luxury resort whereas it's just an ordinary hotel. Good enough for business travelers (Commercial Park nearby) but wouldn't stay they on a private trip. Rooms are ok, steam bath is a plus. But the noise from the street underneath makes a calm night with an open window impossible. Breakfast is rather modest, thumbs up for a choice of pastry and possibility of getting good coffee from the bar (the one on the buffet table is vile) but apart from that - not much more to eat. Staff speaks hardly any English and is not much welcoming. Quite a distance from the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Why close parts of this 'resort' during the busiest time of the year for tourists??”
Reviews.Author: killickgolly
Reviews.Content: Right next to a very busy road which is always bustling with traffic so lots of noise sadly. The rooms are exactly what you expect and are good enough to get your head down (as that is what they are for). I asked for a double (king size) bed in my room and upon arrival we found that two single beds had been pushed together instead. The fact that this is advertised as a resort made me want to book it as it sounded fantastic to be able to do everything on site but sadly they closed the restaurant (which then means a very long walk to find somewhere to eat), the shops too were closed and the bar only opened until 1900 hours which is very poor indeed. My tip basically is if you want to go here DO NOT book August as you will be dissapointed. If you do not have a car then hire one as it is a great distance from almost everything, but with a car and sat nav you will easily find places like the Vatican Museum etc and these are well worth the visit. The resort may well live up to it's 4 star standard throughout the year but during my stay here it would have been lucky to have achieved 1 star. The staff did not seem bothered about things been closed and all they suggested was to get a taxi to take us to various places which would have resulted in a huge cost as taxis are very expensive in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “a big jump in the sixties”
Reviews.Author: bambou13
Reviews.Content: as i stated,when entering this hotel one should be prepared to walk into a bourgeois setting from the sixties lost in the twenty first century.to be more "retro" than this hotel is really difficult. phones,tv , electricity come and go as they wish.room service is excellent but you pay the high prices of corsetti as the famous restaurant is the provider. service is good if you can stand people serving you in a very stern and bad mood.you do feel that they are too good to serve you and when we dared express our disatisfaction they looked at us as if "mars attacks"......last but not least check your hotel bill as to the reception desk "il computer" is their only god and reference! we had to recalculate our bill and they would not trust us that there was a mistake in the bill even after rechecking several times.overall is good if you can stand that mentality and all the disadvantages that come with it !

Reviews.Title: “Funny!”
Reviews.Author: jdallaglio
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Shangri lá Hotel, Rome, in october 2008. It was a funny experience! We stayed only 2 days, and the rooms are in rococó style, wide and lightening. We had dinner in the restaurant, with alive music and very good service. Besides, we had lunch, althoug a little expensive, the meat was special, and the red wine delicious. The onlu thing is not good is the localization, near via Ápia,far from historical center.

Reviews.Title: “Me and colleagues all agreed - this hotel is defo not 4 star and defo not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: VeryPickyLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for work with colleagues. We rented meeting rooms and ordered food, so you would expect the hotel to give a good service to a big group from a big company to at least try to impress. Quiet the opposite, the service was below average. My room was a smoker and when asked for a change was told that there is none left. The safe in room didn't work. The furniture was out dated and the bed was uncomfortable. The room wasn't the cleanest. I got headache sleeping in a room that smelled like old cigarettes. Worse than that was the staff at the front desk not being helpful. They wanted to keep our passport for an hour to take a copy and when I asked why they don't copy it right away and give it to me (the copy machine was empty and there), he got grumpy with me and threw my passport to my face. I was like shocked! The only good thing about this hotel was the breakfast, which was nice and the cappuccino at breakfast was great. We dined at the restaurant beside the hotel, which was a great restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay at this hotel again, any time. It was great.”
Reviews.Author: vacation2009Florida
Reviews.Content: Everybody was very helpful and the food was great. The room was very clean and comfortable. My room faced the private courtyard with lots of greenery. Nice pool area with bar. You can walk to the subway and reach the historical part of Rome in 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Shangri La it ain't!”
Reviews.Author: SHADDACalifornia
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? Hotel right on the main road to the Rome airport - noise was bad with slider open. Why was the slider open? Because the AC was not working and it was 84 degrees outside. Unfortunately the bar downstairs WAS working, until 2AM. And we had a 5AM wakeup call! The shower actually had 6 sides. So the odds were that 1,2,3 or more would not fit tightly and you'd be right. Shower doors, for lack of a better word, did not close - and I suspect never did. You can imagine the result. In a country that boasts of Da Vinci and Michaelangelo this was an engineering nightmare. However, the staff prepared bag breakfasts for all 36 of us since we were leaving the hotel before the 6:30 AM opening. Very kind and generous of them - so much food that it barely fit in the doggie bags plus we each got a fresh espresso as we headed out the door.

HotelInfo.Name: Shangri La Corsetti
HotelInfo.Address: Viale Algeria, 141, 00144 Rome, Italy
